sources.name: OECD based on Royuela et al. (2014)
sources.description:
Data published by

OECD (2015), In It Together: Why Less Inequality Benefits All, OECD Publishing, Paris.
Data publisher's source

Royuela, V., P. Veneri and R. Ramos (2014), “Income Inequality, Urban Size and Economic Growth in OECD
Link  http://dx.doi.org/10.1787/888933207870
Retrieved 2016-10-28

 

Each observation corresponds to a different sub-national region. France, for example, is divided in 22 different regions. The source notes that these regions correspond in most cases to the principal sub-national unit of government (states or provinces)

variables.name: Average annual growth rate of GDP per capita
